perturbation.original_text:
Hereafter referred to as the "Company" or "AZUL",

On the one part,

AND:

AVIONS DE TRANSPORT REGIONAL, G.I.E., a French groupement d'intérêt économique established under articles L.251-1 to L251-23 of the French Commercial Code, whose registered office is at 1 allée Pierre Nadot, 31712 Blagnac, France identified under Corporate and Trade Register of Toulouse number 323 932 236,

Hereafter referred to as the "Repairer' or "ATR", On the other part.
perturbation.changed_text:
Hereafter referred to as the "Company" or "AZUL",

On the one part,

AND:

AVIONS DE TRANSPORT REGIONAL, G.I.E., a French groupement d'intérêt économique established under articles L.251-1 to L251-23 of the French Commercial Code, whose registered office is at 1 allée Pierre Nadot, 31712 Blagnac, France identified under Corporate and Trade Register of Toulouse number 323 932 236,

Hereafter referred to as the "Service Provider" or "ATR", On the other part.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Repairer' is changed to 'Service Provider.' This introduces ambiguity because the contract now uses different terms ('Repairer' in later sections, but 'Service Provider' here) to refer to the same entity, potentially leading to disputes about which obligations apply.

perturbation.original_text: The Repairer, its Affiliates and/or its Subcontractors as applicable shall remain the exclusive owner of any intellectual property right related to the Services including: design of the LRUs, Main Elements, job cards, task cards, operating manual or industrial process, as relevant. No title to or other ownership interest in
perturbation.changed_text: The Vendor, its Affiliates and/or its Subcontractors as applicable shall remain the exclusive owner of any intellectual property right related to the Services including: design of the LRUs, Main Elements, job cards, task cards, operating manual or industrial process, as relevant. No title to or other ownership interest in
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Repairer' is changed to 'Vendor.' This introduces ambiguity because the contract now uses different terms ('Vendor' here, but 'Repairer' in other sections) to refer to the same entity, potentially leading to disputes about ownership interest of intellectual property.

perturbation.original_text:
WHEREAS the Repairer and the Company agree to amend the GMA in order to update the number of [*****] required for the invoicing; and,

WHEREAS the Parties wish to amend certain provisions of the GMA upon the terms and conditions set out below.
perturbation.changed_text:
WHEREAS the Supplier and the Company agree to amend the GMA in order to update the number of [*****] required for the invoicing; and,

WHEREAS the Parties wish to amend certain provisions of the GMA upon the terms and conditions set out below.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Repairer' is changed to 'Supplier.' This introduces ambiguity because the contract now uses different terms ('Supplier' here, but 'Repairer' in other sections) to refer to the same entity, potentially leading to disputes about invoicing.
